Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the preliminary murder rates in Philadelphia by stating that they will be the highest of the decade, without considering previous years' data.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide specific data or evidence to back up the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the preliminary murder rates will continue to increase at the same rate throughout the year, without considering potential fluctuations or changes.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the increase in murder rates, such as changes in policing strategies, socio-economic factors, or other external factors that may influence crime rates.
